dt: {bc}to put a question {bc}seek for information by questioning

dt.t: some kindred spirit shall {wi}inquire{/wi} thy fate

pt: {sc}ask{/sc} {sc}question{/sc} {sc}interrogate{/sc} {sc}query{/sc} {sc}inquire{/sc} mean to address a person in order to gain information. {sc}ask{/sc} implies no more than the putting of a question.
{sc}question{/sc} usually suggests the asking of series of questions.

pt.t: {it}questioned{/it} them about every detail of the trip

pt: {sc}interrogate{/sc} suggests formal or official systematic questioning.

pt.t: the prosecutor {it}interrogated{/it} the witness all day

pt: {sc}query{/sc} implies a desire for authoritative information or confirmation.
{sc}inquire{/sc} implies a searching for facts or for truth often specifically by asking questions.

pt.t: began to {it}inquire{/it} of friends and teachers what career she should pursue

et: Middle English {it}enquiren{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}enquerre{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*inquaerere{/it}, alteration of Latin {it}inquirere{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}quaerere{/it} to seek
shortdef: to put a question : seek for information by questioning
to make investigation or inquiry —often used with into
